stories.text:
I've been reading a lot about micro-startups lately, and one of the primary questions I am failing to understand is that how are entrepreneurs able to acquire customers for their product?

I am skeptical of the capabilities of the micro-saas culture, the only way it seems to work is if there already a customer base for the product and somehow you are able to capture the customer base by either shorting the competition or building tremendous value.

Any good experts or resources that guide me through this turmoil? What I am expecting is a step by step guide that can help me generate let's say $500 MRR?

I understand what I am requesting is difficult, however I am only looking for the way?
stories.title: Ask HN: Micro-SaaS

stories.text:
I'm mainly a back end dev, but with a new in-house project I need to be able to ship a simple HTML page with the outputs of another process (like a report). Id prefer to avoid the bigger css and js frameworks if possible, for transportability, simplicity, and conflict minimisation.

What is your go to for a very simple HTML page drag and drop style builder? Despite the simplicity desired id still like something at least a little nice looking.
stories.title: Ask HN: What's your go to for quick and simple HTML/JS?
